snippet: Tom Durkin, who called more than 80,000 horse races with an imaginative and captivating style, worked his final race on Sunday at Saratoga Race Course.
abstract: Postcard from Saratoga Springs; legendary track announcer Tom Durkin, whose 25-year career provided the real-time oral history of modern throughbred racing, calls his last race and walks off into the uncertain life of a retiree.
lead_paragraph: Tom Durkin, who called more than 80,000 horse races with an imaginative and captivating style, worked his final race on Sunday at Saratoga Race Course.

headline.seo: Tom Durkin, the Voice of New York Horse Racing, Retires
headline.main: And He’s Off: A Track Legend Calls It a Career
headline.print_headline: And He’s Off: A Track Legend Calls It a Career
